H0.text: Which acid is found in apples. Malic Acid

H1.text: Which acid is found in apples. Citric Acid

H2.text: Which acid is found in apples. Tartaric Acid

H3.text: Which acid is found in apples. E296

A4.text: Malic acid was first isolated from apple juice by Carl Wilhelm Scheele in 1785.

A5.text: Malic acid, when added to food products, is denoted by E number E296.

A6.text: Other fruits with tartaric acid are bananas, avocados, prickly pear fruit, apples, cherries, papayas, peaches, pears, pineapples, strawberries, mangoes and citrus fruits.

A7.text: The acid itself is added to foods as an antioxidant E334 and to impart its distinctive sour taste.
